author: Ashish Mehta
title: Anupam Kher comes to the rescue of a suicidal fan
text:
Jaipur Film actor-director Anupam Kher on Tuesday provided a 'Kuch Bhi Ho Sakta Hai' (Anything can happen) moment to a city youth by inviting him to watch his play 'Mera Woh Matlab Nahin Thaa' directed by Rakesh Bedi.
READ: Anupam Kher to play a football coach in Kaanu
The youth, Sourav Maan, a Jaipurite, earlier in the day had threatened the actor though that he will kill himself if he will not get the pass. The actor not only obliged him but urged him not dare to kill himself and live life and become a good human being.
Since morning, when it came to the notice of Sourav Maan, who claimed to be a big fan of Kher, that he was in town for the play, he started tweeting, asking the actor to provide one pass for the show.
The happy ending of this high-drama was written by Kher when he tweeted, "Your more than 100 tweets almost killed me. You don't kill yourself. Come to box office. Will keep a pass 4 u."
The boy came to the Birla Auditorium and met the actor along with Rakesh Bedi and actress Neena Gupta . "You can see the play and promise me not to think and say that you will kill yourself."
And the boy after handing over a chocolate to Kher went inside the auditorium to watch the play.
The play was staged as a part of Jairangam - a theatre and art festival in Jaipur.
